item.title: [SPR-1998] Misc. bugs in spring.ftl - IDs not used correctly and 'options' not HTML-escaped
item.summary: Misc. bugs in spring.ftl - IDs not used correctly and 'options' not HTML-escaped

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Gosh, sorry, I wasn't expecting the issue tracker to allow me to submit an empty report. I can't find an edit button anywhere.

This is what I wanted to say:

There are a couple of bugs in the spring.ftl Freemarker macro library that I would like to address. Apologies if bugs shouldn't be grouped together like this, I thought it was more efficient to do this as they are minor bugs and I haven't contributed to this bug tracker before.

1. Incorrect IDs

Currently, it incorrectly adds 'id' attributes with the same value as the field name to all the HMTL form elements - this results in HTML that doesn't validate and doesn't make sense if, for example some JavaScript tries to access an element by ID. For example, using spring.ftl you might write a template snippit:

<@spring.formRadioButtons path="command.favColour" options=colourOpts separator="<br />"/>

This may give the output:

<input type="radio" id="favColour" name="favColour" value="red" /> Red<br />
<input type="radio" id="favColour" name="favColour" value="blue" /> Blue<br />

Which of course is not valid since you get more than one element with the same ID. The name attribute should not be unique as this defines the radio button group - so that should stay as it is.

I would propose that all of the text-input type fields have an id parameter that is ignored if empty, or used to generate an id="ID" attribute if not empty. At first I thought the id could just default to status.expression if no id was specified, but this would lead to a lot of invalid IDs (consider "myContact.phoneNumbers[4].extension").

For group input elements (radio buttons only?) the id attribute should be some root name with the option index concatinated, e.g. if the root name is favColour, then the IDs would be favColour0, favColour1, favColour2...

I asked for comments on the web forum, but nobody seems to have any strong feelings about having valid markup:

http://forum.springframework.org/showthread.php?t=23566

2. 'Options' not HTML-escaped properly

There is a bug in form fields that use an options parameter - both the keys and values need to be HTML-escaped to work properly.

3. Not a bug?
Lastly, it would be great if radio buttons and check boxes both used the <label></label> element - this makes a big difference to usability, accessibility and CSS possibilities. I would like to change the FTL to include labels.

I would be happy to make the changes and submit as a patch if anyone is interested.
Thanks
Matt
